title: Paging Dr. Michaels
description: Ann Anderson is the new assistant administer and finds a very eccentric staff at Kensington General.

title: Final Exams
description: Charley has problems when his old high school teacher shows up as a patient.

title: Side to Side
description: The classic situation where Charley has two dates at the same restaurant at the same time.

title: Crisis of Confidence
description: Norman can't operate on a patient due to the family's religious beliefs. An operation goes wrong for Charlie.

title: Defeat of Clay
description: Ann is attracted to a famous doctor and Charlie is jealous.

title: A Slight Case of Quarantine
description: The staff gets quarantined together after the threat of smallpox.

title: Mobster Tale
description: A convicted felon needs an operation.

title: Old Is Beautiful
description: When Kensington General gets a new administer, Amos is forced to retire.

title: The Phantom of Kensington
description: The staff is searching for a thief and a mystery doctor.

title: Beast of Kensington
description: Laid up by a bad back, Charlie is a very poor patient.

title: I'll Be Suing You
description: Kensington is almost the victim of a con artist who fakes an accident.

title: Take My Granddaughter Please
description: Amos has a clumsy granddaughter who is trying to make it in the medical profession.

title: Rock Around the Doc
description: Ann Anderson gets a job offer from a famous music star.

title: Jailhouse Doc
description: After refusing to divulge confidential patient information, Charley lands in jail.

title: Sex and the Single Surgeon
description: The entrance of a new woman doctor causes trouble at Kensington General.

title: Muggers and Other Strangers
description: Ann has her hands full with an amorous auditor and a missing mugger.

title: Nude Girl
description: Ann defends a nurse who is being fired for posing nude for a men's magazine.

title: Kensington Follies
description: A Christmas show is put on by the staff for the patients.

title: The Dead Beat
description: A practical joke playing doctor is loose in Kensington.

title: Tenants, Anyone?
description: Ann's apartment house is going condo and Charley is one of the owners.

title: In Case of Emergency
description: Charlie has emergency room duty the night of his date with Ann.

title: No Balls, One Strike
description: With the staff on strike, the doctors have to do everyone's job.

title: Bombing Out
description: There's a bomb in the hospital!

title: Six O'Clock Noose
description: A news crew is filming a day in the life of Kensington.

title: Officer Needs Assistance
description: Charley performs a fake operation to get around Mr. Peckler.

title: My Son, the Anarchist
description: The staff helps a man sneak in and visit his dying father.

title: All About Adam
description: When Ann finds another doctor attractive, Charlie starts to feel jealous.

title: Bye, Bye American Spy
description: A spy sneaks into Kensington to try and converse with a patient in a coma.

title: The Magnificent Weatherbys
description: All the Weatherbys show up when it appears that the doctor is dying.

title: Kleptos and Other Maniacs
description: Suspects abound when the hospital is suffering a rash of thefts.

title: Adieu, Kind Friend
description: After too many broken dates Ann wants to stir Charley up a bit.

title: The Hostage Situation
description: Peckler and Ann are being held hostage at Kensington.

title: Have Peckler, Will Travel
description: The male staff members are trapped in a cabin during a forest fire.

title: Lust Weekend
description: Charley asks Ann to marry him. At first she says yes.

title: The Kensington Connection
description: Fed up with trying to obtain it legally, Amos starts to grow his own marijuana for his patients.

title: Uncle Digby
description: The entire hospital is fascinated by the stories from Ann's Uncle Digby.

title: The Sex Police
description: Keeping secret the information about a pregnant teenager causes problems for Charley.

title: Bradley's Brat
description: Ann is helping Nurse Bradley with her teenager.

title: The Yes Man
description: Amos is staying with Ann while his house is painted.

title: Doctor Soloman and Mister Hide
description: Norman considers a change in life and goes for a walk on the wild side.

title: Son of Emergency
description: The overworked doctors have to deal with the weirdos they meet on the night-shift in the emergency room.

title: Losers Weepers
description: A patient runs away from a life saving operation and Ann may be running back to England.

title: Fun with Doc & Jane
description: The woman replacing Ann is one of Charley's old girlfriends.

title: Gays of Our Lives
description: Peckler tries to fire a doctor who admits to being gay.

title: Man for All Surgeons
description: Charlie is unsure of himself when he is fired by his own patient.

title: Con-Con
description: A woman is tricked by a conman and Norman comes to her rescue.

title: Alien Food
description: After Norman puts the hospital chef on a diet, he suffers a heart attack.

title: It Ain't Necessary to Sew
description: Charlie wants to stop a surgeon from performing unnecessary operations.

title: Conventional Warfare
description: In Las Vegas Charley and Jane get connecting rooms, but don't want Norman to know.

title: Hook, Line & Sinker
description: Charley thinks that Amos' new young girlfriend is a classic gold-digger.

title: Campaign in the Neck
description: To help a Senator who has mood swings, Charley wants him to have an operation.

title: Rising Cost of Poverty
description: Charlie tries to help a family who's son needs an operation and they don't qualify for aid.

title: Deafenwolf
description: Could a patient be a genuine werewolf?

title: The Weatherbys Ride Again
description: The Weatherby family shows up honoring his 40th anniversary in medicine.

title: Ducks of Hazzard
description: Jane and Charley have to deal with a case of food poisoning.

title: In Norman We Trust
description: Charlie suffers from insomnia, Norman suffers from over confidence.

title: Bone of My Bone
description: While Norman deals with his mother, a patient adopts Charley as his father.
